intro: Cyrtandra coleoides, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and streamside areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are hairy and somewhat woody. Cyrtandra coleoides plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
